channel.title: Running A .cmd In The Background(Hidden)
channel.description:
Hi guys, I recently noticed you could compleatly hide your command windows such as compile and runserver. I dont know how to do this and I was hoping you guys could help me out on this one.
[code]
cd ../bin title Running 508 Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\java.exe" -cp . palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 cls [/code] Thats my runserver right now

item.title: Running A .cmd In The Background(Hidden)
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

make it a .exe file or a .jar file (convert it to that form)

Read full topic

item.title: Running A .cmd In The Background(Hidden)
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Thats not what i wanted, I wanted it to run without showing anything, not even a blank window. thx anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Running A .cmd In The Background(Hidden)
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

@echo on cd ../bin title Running 508 Server "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\java.exe" -cp . palidino76/rs2/Server 43594 cls

Read full topic

item.title: Running A .cmd In The Background(Hidden)
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Hi guys, I recently noticed you could compleatly hide your command windows such as compile and runserver. I dont know how to do this and I was hoping you guys could help me out on this one.


cd ../bin
title Running 508 Server
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\java.exe" -cp . palidino76/rs2/Server 43594
cls

Thats my runserver right now

Read full topic
